meanings.definition: The ability to stand upright or be raised to an upright position.
meanings.sent1: The tree's erectility allowed it to sway gracefully in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The robot's erectility made it easy for it to reach high shelves.
meanings.sent3: The erectility of the giraffe's neck made it the envy of all other animals.
meanings.sent4: The skyscraper's erectility reached towards the sky like a giant steel tree.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape billowed behind him, a symbol of his erectility and strength.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being capable of becoming rigid or firm.
meanings.sent1: The erectility of the frozen lake made it safe to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The metal's erectility allowed it to be molded into various shapes.
meanings.sent3: The erectility of the jello surprised the party guests as it stood firm on the plate.
meanings.sent4: His erectility of mind made him unwavering in his beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The erectility of the mountain range stood as a testament to the earth's strength.

meanings.definition: The property of being able to be raised or elevated.
meanings.sent1: The hot air balloon's erectility allowed it to soar high above the landscape.
meanings.sent2: The flag's erectility in the wind symbolized freedom and pride.
meanings.sent3: The erectility of the helium balloon made it a favorite at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her erectility of spirit lifted her above life's challenges.
meanings.sent5: The kite's erectility in the sky brought joy to the children below.
